valueString:
Patient:   BREAU, JOHN  A


Sex#:      M                             
DOB#       12/20/1971                       Corp#:    01447998
Location:  SLN MRI                     Accession#: 8861206
 
Procedure Requested:  IMG5065 MRI CERVICAL SPINE W WO CONTRAST
Reason for Exam:  Schwannomatosis (HCC)
Exam Ordered:        9/27/2018  1152
Exam Date/Time:      9/27/2018  1252
Begin exam date/time:  9/27/2018  1156
 
 
 MRI CERVICAL SPINE W WO CONTRAST 


Date:  September 27, 2018 


Reason for exam: Radiculopathy. History of schwannomatosis


Technique:  Multiplanar, multipulse sequence images of the cervical
spine were obtained before and after the administration of 17 mL
MultiHance IV gadolinium contrast.


Comparison: No direct comparison available. July 7, 2011 neck.


Findings: The brainstem and cerebellum are normal signal and
configuration. Spinal cord shows normal caliber and signal intensity.
Spinal cord shows no enhancing mass or lesion.


Cervical vertebral bodies show normal height and alignment. There is no
focal marrow edema to suggest acute osseous abnormality. There is no
suspicious or worrisome marrow signal. There is no suspicious osseous
enhancement.


There is mild generalized disc desiccation and intervertebral disc space
narrowing. No suspicious intradiscal enhancement is seen.


C2-C3: There is no disc bulge or herniation. There is no spinal canal
stenosis. Mild bilateral facet hypertrophy. There is no neural foraminal
stenosis.


C3-C4: There is no disc bulge or herniation. There is no spinal canal
stenosis. There is mild right uncinate hypertrophy. Mild bilateral facet
hypertrophy. Mild right neural foraminal stenosis.


C4-C5: Minimal Central disc bulge. No spinal canal stenosis. Mild
bilateral uncinate hypertrophy. No neural foraminal stenosis.


C5-C6: Minimal Central disc bulge. No spinal canal stenosis. Mild
bilateral uncinate hypertrophy. Mild bilateral facet hypertrophy. Mild
left neural foraminal stenosis.


C6-C7: Central disc herniation. Mild spinal canal stenosis. Mild
bilateral uncinate hypertrophy, left worse than right. Moderate
bilateral neural foraminal stenosis.


C7-T1: There is no disc bulge or herniation. There is no spinal canal
stenosis. There is bilateral uncinate hypertrophy. Mild bilateral facet
arthrosis. Moderate bilateral neural foraminal stenosis.


There are numerous enhancing masses throughout the superficial and deep
soft tissues of the neck and in the paraspinal soft tissues. This
includes multiple bilobed T2 signal hyperintensity lesions with
homogeneous enhancement in the bilateral neural foramen. These are
larger within the left neural foramen at C2-3, C3-4, and C4-5. These
appear to extend along multiple midline and peripheral nerve roots. No
rim-enhancing or drainable soft tissue collection is identified.
